text:
This is a problem in 4.0.2 (4.0.2 Final Not yet an option in the Version 
listbox)

Starting up catalina with default configuration fails if you move xerces.jar 
from /common/lib to server/lib.
creator: matt@clickability.com

text:
Yes, there must be components in common/lib or one of its child CL which 
require an XML parser (Jasper is one of them).
creator: remm@apache.org
matt@clickability.com
text:
Seems to me like this is a valid bug. Because If you cannot move xerces.jar out 
of /common/lib, you can end up with conflicts if you want to use a different 
XML parser in webapps (Xerces 2.0.0).

Also, I had no problem doing this with 4.0.2-b2, and the readme for 4.0.1 says 
that this is what you should do if you want to use a different SAX parser.

No it's not, because it wouldn't work anyway (Jasper should class cast).

The webapp can now use the XML parser it wants, regardless of what the parser 
is in the common classloader, unless it loads the XML parser through JAXP.

Overall, I'm afraid there won't be any solution to the XML parser handling 
which would satisfy everyone :-( That problem has the easiest workaround of 
them all.
creator: remm@apache.org
